ygData.subject: Re: newbie- im
ygData.msgSnippet: Actually I feel that locals playing together is pretty good enuf, not necessary to form an official guild.  My UO guild started off with only 4-5 locals,
ygData.messageBody:
Actually I feel that locals playing together is pretty good enuf, not
necessary to form an official guild. My UO guild started off with only 4-5
locals, purely for the sake of helping one another, play together rather
than to form an formal guild. I also can't remember since when more and
more players seek to join us ;) Most importantly, no matter we role-play
as good or evil, dun 'seah shui' S'poreans' faces, hehe.

My suggestion is the existing players can post more info abt the game,
particularly the game play performance in each shard. I bet most of the
local players are still in a stage of below lvl 20, and it's still not too
difficult for all to shift to the best shard to play in.

I'm now waiting for my copy of EQ, and sincerely appreciate all in-game
info posted by local players ;) I personally look for a lag-free server
with good server down time close to our timezone, so that I dun have to
come back home from work just to wait for server to come up *grin*.

Dark Flame



On Tuesday, April 27, 1999 5:26 PM, Wilson [SMTP:ritzbits@...]
wrote:
> From: "Wilson" <ritzbits@...>
>
> Greetings,
> In one of my last posts, I mentioned that I would doubt a Singapore Guild
> forming for at least the next 8 months cos...
>
> A)You need at least 10 regular memebers that play frequently.
> B)You need to upkeep the guild *IF* I am right ;-)
> C)You have to have a reputation...
> D)The guild must be organised I guess, not like UO where I go around
seeing
> people with titles above their head like [1800-Suk-Ass] or [Masta
Blasta,FG]
>
> I never meant to sound so negative. Sorry but my type tone always seem so
> <grins>.
>
> Wilson
> ----- Original Message -----
> From: LKW <leekw13@...>
> > Hi,
> >
> > I'm guild master of The Dark Wardens of UO. We haven't shifted over to
EQ
> > and most probably won't as many of our members still stay loyal to UO
;)
> >
> > H/w, some of us are coming over to EQ (ie play both games, not migrate
> > totally), maybe as a new guild or using old guild name. So far no
> concrete
> > plan yet, we are all waiting for our copy of EQ, hehe.
> >
> > Regards,
> > Dark Flame
